modules.description: Concatenates two Pp.t values with a sequence operation, preserving tag information. Works with tagged Pp.t structures to build formatted output. Used to combine pretty-printing elements in a fluent, readable manner.

Provides operations to manipulate and transform abstract syntax tree nodes with tagged types, supporting serialization and deserialization. Works with polymorphic variants and recursive structures representing parsed program data. Used to generate stable representations for storing or transmitting parsed code between systems.

Provides functions to construct and manipulate pretty-printing layouts using boxes and break hints, with an emphasis on intuitive algebra for formatting text. Works with custom data types representing formatting instructions and outputs to OCaml's Format.formatter. Useful for generating readable, structured text outputs in applications like debuggers, code generators, or configuration file writers.

Combines tagged pretty-printing elements into structured output while enabling manipulation of abstract syntax tree nodes through tagged types. Supports operations for concatenating formatted content and transforming parsed program data. Allows building complex output sequences and generating stable representations for serialization. Can be used to create readable formatted text or prepare code structures for storage and transmission.
